comment.author: 37835289@N02
comment._content: Award For Best Photo In The Universe (post1 – award 5)

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'm not 100% sure, but I suspect the chap in the blazer might be Fred Perry...compare with this other SLNSW pic where Perry is sitting this side of Pat Hughes - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=43184

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: UPDATE...the chap in the blazer definitely isn't Fred Perry!!!...see this SLNSW pic where these two appear in the front row (far left and second from left) - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50691 ; I've also now found this wonderful pic of Fred Perry which shows his profile from the rhs - www.npgprints.com/image/413729/bassano-fred-perry ...my excuse is that these sporty types all looked a bit like Fred Perry in the 1930s (!).

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: UPDATE...UPDATE...this time I'm not guessing (believe me!)...but I could still be wrong (!)...Just going on a pictorial item on a naval cricket match which appeared in the Sydney society magazine "The Home" on 2/2/1931, p. 18, I'd say this is a pic of Capt William Chalmers (of HMAS Australia) and Sydney socialite Miss Rosemary Shepherd. The cricket match was evidently played at Lyne Park, Rose Bay, in January 1931. "The Home" item featured several of Sam Hood's pics which are in the SLNSW collection (see links below), but for some reason this one wasn't included...maybe it was considered inappropriate given Capt Chalmers was married...From what I can scrape together courtesy of various sources, Chalmers was on loan from the Royal Navy in the period 1929-1931, during which time he was Captain of HMAS Australia. Later in his career he became a Rear Admiral - www.npgprints.com/image/941012/hay-wrightson-ltd-william-... The first 4 of these SLNSW pics all appear in "The Home" item with captions which enable us to identify some of the people involved...alas the dog isn't named...going on the captions, it's in the custody of Mrs Chalmers - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50691 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50695 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50692 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50688 Several other Sam Hood pics in the SLNSW collection also appear to have been taken at the naval cricket match...as is evident Sam Hood needed a couple of goes to get the main group pic right...people blinking out of sync etc. acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50680 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50681 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50694 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50689 Not quite so sure about these ones - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50683 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=50684 ; Discovered whilst drawing more blanks trying to track down the cruelly maligned mother-in-law... www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/5444358738/

comment._content: Thanks Quasymody - you've given us some more work but looks like you're on the right track. Not sure about the "captain" though!
